subject: Web3
title: Coordination Failures
description: Learn Coordination Failures in one minute.

hook.text: Getting thousands of anonymous people to agree on anything is painfully hard. DAOs prove this daily.

buildup.text: Proposals stall in forums for weeks. Decisions that a CEO makes in minutes take DAOs months of discussion.

discovery.text: Some DAOs created working groups and committees to speed things up â€” essentially recreating corporate structures.

twist.text: Committees with decision-making power are hierarchies. DAOs keep reinventing the structures they claim to replace.

climax.text: Pure flat governance doesn't scale. Every successful DAO eventually adds some form of hierarchy.

punchline.text: DAOs abolished hierarchy. Then rebuilt it under a different name.

quiz.question: Why do DAOs struggle with decision-making speed?
options: Coordinating anonymous global participants through votes is inherently slow
